node.title: Search Functionality in KnackSteem
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
#### Repository
https://github.com/knacksteem/knacksteem.org

#### Pull Request
https://github.com/knacksteem/knacksteem.org/pull/41

#### New Features - Added Search Functionality in KnackSteem.

We had the Search button on the top bar but the search was not implemented. Being a newbie in React, I asked @knowledges if I can work on some task and then after getting a go-ahead to implement Search functionality I started working on it.

The endpoint of searching against User and Post a.k.a. Articles were present, we just have to connect them to the frontend. I started with creating a function which will take a search term and give us data from the API for both User and Posts. 

Relevant Commit : https://github.com/knacksteem/knacksteem.org/pull/41/commits/75dc176bb8ee69743ef78048e436ff6e5c0188f9

Next was to create a new route for search, '/search?q='. So whenever a user clicks on a search button, the user will be taken to that page itself where searched posts and users will be shown. 

![](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmWA8fk8TA1fNTzbDVXUZmFUZ9tdet4nhBN8MdQL8JtWM3/image.png)

We also have to take care two things out here, which are written in the if condition.

1. We will not search if the search term is less than 2, because then the search will be meaningless.
2. If the user has searched and if he clicks again, we should not initiate the search again.

Relevant Commit : https://github.com/knacksteem/knacksteem.org/pull/41/commits/b83c90d96cb53dce10fd4a911810a5d0deaee7e4
 
Next was to show the Search Posts and User. Since I do not want to reinvent the wheel, I just use the existing component to show the Post, though for user I have to write a couple of lines. 

Relevant Commit : https://github.com/knacksteem/knacksteem.org/pull/41/commits/76e1b04a907963ec619e6587205b588b79c1558e

#### Lessons Learnt

A lot of lessons has been learned for creating this functionality, like how to send the data from one component to other, how to use Redux etc. I guess it will be a good leaning curve to continue working on this.

#### GitHub Account

https://github.com/codingdefined

node.title: 32 Feet High Idol
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
Being a Saturday I had few idle hours where I can roam around. I had heard a lot about Hanuman Idol but never went there. So today I decided to utilize my time and visit the temple.

Though it was not far away but trusting Google Maps was my biggest mistake, it shows temple which is like 29 kms away but in reality it was only 13 kms. Though because of that I have ride more than 60 kms.

Never mind it was a happy ending as I got to see the idol and spent quality time in the temple. The best thing about temple or any worship place is that your mind and body get relaxed, and you feel energetic.

Front side of the temple. The idol is 32 feet high and it's carved out of single granite stone, which is awesome to see.

node.title: A Happy Diwali
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
Hello Guys, A Happy Diwali to you all. In india today we are celebrating Diwali which is a festival of light. If you have been to India in Diwali time, you might know that all the houses small or big are decorated with Lights or Diyaa.

Diwali is one of the favorite festivals of India where we just try to get rid of darkness from our life and from our house. And according to the report people tend to gain a lot of weight in these days because of so much food they eat. 

We light Diyaa and Candles, we burst Crackers, we eat varieties of food and have a lot of fun. So if you are coming to India anytime, do consider coming in Diwali time, you will love to be here.

A photo of a Cracker started burning.

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/b52tgy8r0j.jpg)

node.title: Festivity All Around
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
So the festive season in India has been started, first one was Navratri or Durga Puja whereas in a week's time it will be Diwali. Diwali is most celebrated festival in India where everyone will light up their home and surroundings, it is just like good fighting the evil.

We light up our homes to keep the darkness away, we pray to keep everyone healthy, safe and prosperous. We eat without worrying about getting fat and we burn crackers. So as the festive season has started a lot of malls will be decorated, one such mall which I visited today was Garuda Mall in Bangalore.

In the entrance there was a kind of lighting which denotes a Grand Gate of a palace.

node.title: The Power of Faith
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
#### If you want to suceed then you need to keep faith on yourself.

I hear this sentence from my inner self as well as my family members and frinds, whenever I am depressed or feel low. Faith is the belief you keep on yourself to become your own role model. People all over the world use symbols or representative for worship, be it river, structure, book, idols or even charms. These are the center's of faith which benefit the believers by fulfilling their desires.

Now the question is, how come some people prayers are answered whereas others it's not. This is where the faith come into picture. This is just like a physical science where faith gives you desired result by the power of your soul. In Hindi it's called Atma-Shakti or inner power. The science I am talking about is the Newton third law where every action has its equal reaction, just like if you throw a ball against a wall it will rebound with equal force.

When you pray with your full power, your faith along with the force of soul strikes with the force to your believed object and rebound back as a desired results. Now we must understand that to fulfill that results not only your faith but your action should also go hand in hand. There is a saying in India that God help those people who wants to help themselves. If you have the faith, but do not have a inner strength to the work then you will not get the desired results.

> A Quote : The reason birds can fly and we can't is simple because they have perfect faith, for to have faith is to have wings. J.M. Barrie
